body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is the smallest positive integer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that the last three digits of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 123 \\times N "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are 001?"}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Nice calculations."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"However, I would like to point out that when finding the minimum possible value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \overline{abc} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", you want to minimize "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", as opposed to the other way around. E.g. To find the smallest 3-digit number that is a multiple of 3, you'd want "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a = 1, b = 0, c = 2 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". As opposed to saying "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" c = 0, b = 0, a = 3 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This doesn't affect your solution, because there is a unique value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Hence, instead of saying"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"blockquote","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
  "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c=7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" will be the "},{"type":"text","text":"least number possible","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" to give us unit digit as 1."}]},{"type":"text","text":"
"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"it should instead be"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"blockquote","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
  "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c = 7 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the "},{"type":"text","text":"only possible value","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" to give us unit digit as 1."}]},{"type":"text","text":"
"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Likewise for the case of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and the case of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is properly written.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Hah, I used a Python program because I was tired of guessing values on my calculator. (I knew that the last digit was 7 though, so calcing wasn't too hard)

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Basically, we are looking at the numbers that can be multiplied to 123 to produce the digits 001. For example, for the units digit, only 7 can be multiplied to 3 to obtain a number with a units digit of 1.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Indeed, you should have mentioned in your solution that you used the technique of Euclidean Algorithm to find the multiplicative inverse. That will help others understand how you worked it out (instead of plucking the number magically from thin air).

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            gcd(1000, 123) = 1, so we can apply the extended Euclidean algorithm: 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1000 - 123 * 8 =16"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"123 - 16 * 7 = 11"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"16 - 11*1 = 5"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"11 -5*2 = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"Plugging back in backwards, we find that:"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"11-(16-11*1)*2 = 1\rightarrow 3*11-2*16 = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3*(123-16*7)-2*16 = 1\rightarrow 3*123-23*16=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3*123-23*(1000-123*8)=1\rightarrow 187 * 123-23*1000=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"187*123\equiv1(mod1000)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            How did you deduce that 187 was the multiplicative inverse mod 1000 of 123?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Assume "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N=\frac{}{abc}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where a is the hundred's digit, b is the ten's digit, and c is the one's digit."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We know that the ones digit has to be 1. The ones digit of the final product is the is the ones digit of the product of the ones digits of 123 and N. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3N=\frac{}{f1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where f is a single digit number. The only number that works is 7, because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3*7=21"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ten's digit is the sum of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"((2*7+2)+3c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"16+3c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has to have a one's digit of zero. The only number that adds with 6 to get some number of zero is 4. So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3c=\frac{}{d4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where d is another single digit number. 3*8=24, so the ten's digit is 8. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"At this point it would be easiest to simply do guess and check, since we narrowed it down to 10 numbers."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"123*87=10701"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"123*187=23001"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"187 gives us a product of 23001, so the answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{87}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                            answer = 187"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"00861
09840"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":1}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"12300"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"23001"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"to get 1st digit "1" in 001 , 3 in 123 should be multiplied by 7"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so 7 is units digit of N"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"units digit of 123 * 7 = 861 
6 need 4 to be 0 in 001
so the next number is 8 as 8*3 = 24"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Sorry , forgot to mention that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must end in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2nd"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" line.

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"See ..we go by the intuitive approach..
first step is to multiply with 7(as to get 1 in the last pos)
then see which next number gives you a sum 0...
continue till u get the last 3.. :)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We know that 3*(last digit of N) has last digit of 1. The only number from 0-9 that satisfies this condition is 7. Therefore we know that the unit digit of N = 1."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let the number be xy7
123*7 = 861"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"codeBlock","content":[{"type":"text","text":"        123
       *xy7
"}],"attrs":[{"text":"        123
       *xy7
","language":null}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"codeBlock","content":[{"type":"text","text":"        8 6 1
 y(2y)(3y)
   (3x)
"}],"attrs":[{"text":"        8 6 1
 y(2y)(3y)
   (3x)
","language":null}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By the good old multiplication by hand method, last digit of (3"},{"type":"text","text":"y+6) = 0 *(or (3","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"y+6)%10 = 0)*
This implies that (3*y)%10 = 4, smallest y = 8. 6+24 = 30, bring over 3 to left side."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(3+8+2"},{"type":"text","text":"y+3","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"x)%10 = 0
(3+8+16+3"},{"type":"text","text":"x)%10 = 0
(27+3","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"x)%10 = 0
(3*x)%10 = 3
x = 1."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus, smallest "},{"type":"text","text":"N = 187","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
